segments.text: I watch as the water starts to seep further across the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There's a nagging worry deep in my chest as the puddle grows.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman remains focused, so unaware of the impending chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This moment feels like a metaphor for the everyday distractions of life.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Children often find joy in the smallest things, like stealing a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, I understand the weight of the risks theyâ€™re taking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel my own childhood nostalgia mixed with concern.
segments.speaker: PAR
